summary: The Federal Adjustment of Income Rates Act, or FAIR Act (H.R. 493), proposes a 4.3% pay increase for federal employees for 2026. This raise is composed of a 3.3% across-the-board increase in basic pay for both statutory and prevailing rate employees, and an additional 1% adjustment to locality pay. Introduced by Representative Connolly and co-sponsors, the bill aims to adjust the rates of pay for federal workers under various statutory systems. It has been referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform for consideration.
